signevent: Painting with friends at my local cafe.

Sometimes on the weekends me and three of my friends like to head to our local coffee shop/cafe and paint together. We bring little sketchbooks lined with watercolor or gouache paper and set up camp near one of the bay windows with lots of good natural light.

 One of my friends is a black and white kinda guy but I like to paint in color. I bring 6 tiny pots of watercolors in an Altoids tin. It's very adorable. Everyone chats, paints, listens to music and indulges in an extra fancy latte...or several. Our sessions last for about 4 hours and  it's a pretty cozy fun time.
q2: We all went to art school together and it's just a hobby we all formed. We usually start in the late mornings and paint til the afternoon.

signevent: Redecorating the bathroom with a cork finish for more comfort.
q1:
The house is old and insulation is poor, the intent is to line out the bathroom internally with cork tiles to improve individual comfort through the warm feeling that cork gives.
Cork tiles are self adhesive and will be primed with appropriate synthetic resin primer before applying at least two coats of an appropriate bathroom paint.
about 3/4 of the wall surface will be cork tiles, the remaining 1/4 ceramic wall tiles around shower/bath area.
q2:
The cork tiles have been purchased through Amazon are 4mm thick self adhesive, without sealant.
The synthetic resin primer has been purchased through an online construction materials company and the paint top coat finish will be purchased from a local high street shop.
The work should take 4 to 5 days including joint filling and sanding before primer is applied.

signevent: To go a boot fair to look for bargains to keep and to sell on.
q1: I am a collector of antiques and collectables vintage item, from pottery, glass, clocks and watches. Anything that is collectable. I keep what I like and also I buy things to sell on, which pays for the things I want to keep.  What I sell pays for the items I want to keep, so I pretty much Get the items that I keep free!
q2: Bootfairs are the best place to look for the best barains. You can buy things for 1 or 2pounds and sell it for a lot more. Most of the sellers who sell at bootfairb do not really understand the true value of the things they sell. I have many years of experience. I read A lot about the things I like to collect. I still make mistakes, but that's how you learn. I am always learning something New in this game. But it is a very good game. Going to a boot fair can be a big adventure for me because you really don't know what you will find.

signevent: Getting a Swedish massage at a day spa
q1: I will drive to a salon/day spa located about 15 minutes from where I live in the afternoon. After I park and walk to the location, I'll check in with the receptionist and wait to be taken back to the spa area. Another woman will come, my masseuse, and lead me to another waiting area. There, I will fill out a form dealing with any health concerns and, after giving the form back to the woman to look over, will be lead to the massage room. There, I will be instructed to prepare for the massage alone. After preparing, the woman will knock and enter the room and I will receive the massage for 45 minutes. After it is over, the woman will leave and I will get dressed and walk with her to the front desk, where I will pay with my credit card and leave.
q2: The massage will cost $40 (plus tip), my appointment is at 1:15 p.m., and my masseuse's name will be Teri (I already booked the appointment).

signevent: Tracking down members of a maverick branch of my family tree
q1: Through DNA testing, I recently became aware of a brand new branch of my family tree. One of my great grandfathers was not who he thought he was. He believed that he was the illegitimate son of a solicitor's daughter and a wealthy businessman, but he was in fact the illegitimate son of a army officer and a woman of an as yet unknown ancestry. My task over the next week (and more) is to track down more about this new branch of my family tree.
q2: My DNA test results conclusively showed that I am not related to the family lines (solicitor and businessman) as other people in those families also had DNA tests completed; these proved that we were not related at all. My mother and first cousin have also taken DNA tests and they confirm the relationships that I found. I have since found DNA matches with members of the army officer's family, and have also linked in my family tree to theirs through civil records (birth, marriage, death records).

signevent: training for a trail running race

I am going to do lots of trail running around my house.  I am going to do a lot of work on my elliptical to get into shape.  I will be doing all sorts of various routines such as High Intensity Interval Training, Long Runs, Easy Runs, Sprints, Splits, etc.
q2: I know the exercises do to.  You have to do easy long runs in order to get your body adjusted for long distances.  You have to do easy runs in order to make your body grow extra cappilaries so that it transport blood better.  It also allows your body to recover.  You have to do strength exercises that are specific to running such as lunges, dynamic lunges, jump lunges, squats, jump squats, etc.  You also have to mix up your runs to keep your body growing and improving.  One run might be flat out.  The next one you do High Intensity Interval Training so that you are used to going flat out when tired.  You then may do splits.

Once this is done we proceed to free sparring with a partner which is my favourite, before a cool down period. At the end we all thank each other with an "Oss" and head home
q2:
My coach is called Stewart McGill. He is the head coach of Urban Krav Maga, the organisation.

If you slide down the silks you will get fabric burns which are very painful. On Thursday I plan to practice my aerial inverts.

signevent: Tomorrow morning I'll be driving 7 hours away to visit my long-distance boyfriend for his birthday.
q1: Tomorrow, I'll be driving 7 hours to visit my long-distance boyfriend for his birthday. Tomorrow is Saturday, but his Birthday is Wednesday, so I plan to stay until Thursday. We are pretty broke so we won't be doing anything wild or expensive, mostly just everyday activities that we aren't normally able to do like cuddling. In preparation for the trip, I burned 6 CDs today, because my aux cord is broken and I can't afford to replace my stereo at the moment. Before arriving at his apartment, I plan to swing by the store to pick up soft pretzels and beer for our reunion. His roommate, Mark, is gone for the weekend, which we are both happy about. Even during our infrequent, brief visits to each other, we rarely have very much privacy.
q2: I am up at 3 a.m. completing this survey because I am too stressed from thinking about the drive tomorrow to sleep.  I spent many hours today working on a birthday card for him. It's not quite done but I finished a fair amount before doing this survey, and now it is drying. I will wake up early and finish. Card-making is a hobby of mine, but I take it to a level that I have not seen in any card-making instructions online. Every card I make is kind of a work of art and takes a long time to design, trial run, and complete. People have told me I should go into it professionally, but I've seen comparable cards priced at $15 and that would not be worth the materials cost and time I put into a single card. Plus, the time, effort, and care I put into my cards is not something that I would want to sell - it's only for people I love. So, I'm up late, fingers and neck very strained from working on the card, and totally, utterly unable to sleep, despite the fact that I will have to undertake a 7 hour drive in... less than 7 hours from now.

signevent: Sequence and Line Dancing
q1: I dance twice a week, at different venues in Leicester UK. The sequence dancing is a set amount of steps done to music. The venue we go to also do Ballroom dancing as well. Ballroom dancing is where you can do any type of dance whether it be Waltz, Quickstep, Tango or Cha cha, which isn't a set dance. Linedancing  is similar to sequence dancing but this is done without a partner, but it is still a set amount of steps done to music.
q2: The First Sequence dance I learned was a dance called The Square Tango, I was only four when I started Sequence dancing. Later when I got married my husband introduced me to Linedancing, which in a way as probably took over Sequence and Ballroom dancing for me especially.

signevent: Meeting up at the house of some friends today to watch nostalgic anime, play board games, eat and drink.
q1: So, years and years ago a couple of us attended an anime convention on a university campus. One night, I heard a lot of absolutely hysterical laughter coming from the floor below my room. I went down to find a lot of people watching soft yaoi (Japanese male/male animated porn) with an alternate, comedy subtitle track. Someone had also cut audio from Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas into it, and scenes from The Power Puff Girls. It was hilarious. They were giving away free copies, so I nabbed one. The original is called My Sexual Harrassment. The comedy sub is called Boku No (My) Sucky Sucky. I hauled it out of it's hiding place and we're going to watch it with some new, unsuspecting friends. Plus something better and more wholesome like Fruits Basket and Cowboy Bebop. Then maybe play Dixit, or The Resistence... or finish off with Card Against Humanity, just to drag us back down into the gutter again. There'll be junk food, take away, beer, and cocktails.
q2: Would you like a screen grab of the FB chat organising it? Otherwise, literally none. I'm some random person behind a screen. I could have made that all up for a laugh. People make up weird things. Though Boku IS real, but good luck finding it online. All I could find when my disc wouldn't work on my player was the original and a few forum posts mentioning the spoof sub. It worked on someone else's player though, so we're hoping it works at this particular friend's place.

There are options for radiation treatment, but the costs are high, and some are very high risk. The chemo drug does enhance the efficacy of radiation, making the cancer cells more sensitive, so radiation is an option for future treatment.

q1: I get the moth trap which consists of a large wooden box, put a bright light on top of the box, with some perspex sheets that go diagonally into the box to prevent moths from escaping, put some egg-boxes in the bottom for any moths that might visit to rest in, and wait until morning.  Moths are attracted to the light and will fall into the box.  In the morning I will check the box to see how many different species of moth there are and how many of each species.  I will record that data, photograph any new moths I have, and then I let the moths go
q2: The fact that I know what a moth trap looks like and that I have described it in some detail, and that I know there are many different species of moths.

signevent: Going round to my friends house to see him, see how he is doing, and just spend some time with him generally.
q1: On Friday or Saturday I'll arrange to go over to my friends home to spend some time with him. I'll call and ask him or he'll call me and ask me over (mid to late afternoon). I'll give him a time which is usually after dinner and gives me a chance to be on time, between 7 and 8pm. I'll get a lift over to his and we'll spend the evening chatting away, listening to music, watching tv. To avoid upsetting his routine, staying to a point I'm uncomfortable or to avoid upsetting the person giving me a lift I'll call for a lift home around 10.30-11pm.
q2: I could get him to speak to you if you'd like?! Beyond that I can only reiterate what I've already said but give extra detail e.g. the lift I get is in a van not a car. I try to see my friend because it gets me out the house but more importantly it gives my friend a little social interaction with someone that isn't his mother or healthcare professionals, he suffers from a mental illness; in my opinion when he hasn't spoke to a friend in a while he's in a much worse state, I'm his only real friend at this point beyond his drug dealer contacts (arguable if you'd consider them to be friends). I try to be there for him and truthfully it's good for me too, something which I make sure he knows because I don't want him thinking he's a charity case, genuinely for all his problems he's a better friend to me than most who have no excuse.

It will be nice to see her relax.  We will return home  after about 3 or 4 hours and I will probably suggests she drives home too.

There is no new information I can add.  The only way for you to check for sure would be to trace me, but I'm not prepared to give that detail.

signevent: Today I will go to the Dr. to get my drains out.
q1: I recently had a breast reduction. I had huge breasts.  I'm not a heavy girl, average I would say. But I had 36J size breasts. After the surgery I will have 36D or DD.  In order to accomplish this task effectively, the Dr. had to put drains in my sides.  The drains have been in 9 days but will be removed today.
q2: Drains are essential elements that are put in for many surgeries. They leave an open hole to the surgical area where excess fluid can continue to "drain" out as opposed to being absorbed by the body. The drains consist of long surgical tubing placed under the skin and have a bulb at the end. The bulb has a valve. During normal operation, the valve is closed on the bulb and the bulb is squeezed to create a suction. The bulbs need to be emptied and measured often. Measuring the liquid that comes out helps the Dr. determine if they can be removed.  I sure hope mine can be removed today.

Part two is where you ride under direction for the first part and autonomously for the second, and include manoevres like roundabouts, angled starts, hill starts and dual carriageways
q2: After a lot of research I decided to do my training with Bristol Motorcycle School at Hambrook. They were the only ones with a proper Mod 1 layout that you could practise on in advance (surprising!). I took my CBT in July 2016 and it runs out in August so I had limited time to fit in training and all 3 of the tests. I wondered if I could do it in time but decided to go for it!  I passed my Mod 1 on 6 July.  If I don't pass my Mod 2 test next Friday I will have to retake my CBT which will be unecessary and a waste of money, but that's the law :-(

signevent: Surfing
q1: Surfing is an activity that involves  using fiberglass covered piece of foam called a surfboard. You take the surfboard to the beach and catch breaking waves. Your ultimate goal is to stand up on the board and ride along the wave.
q2: Surfing often takes place at the beach but you can also surf in rivers, from the wake created from a boat or even artificially generated wave pools. There are many different types of surf breaks around the world. There are surf breaks where the waves break around a point. There are also waves that break onto a reef bottom or a sand bottom. Surfing can take place using a variety of different boards. The most common are shortboards and longboards. Shortboards are used by experienced surfers and professionals. Longboards are best utilized in slow breaking, or small surf as they allow you to travel along the wave effortlessly.

signevent: Spending a couple of days on my sailing boat to do some maintenance and to sail in the harbour, from Friday to Saturday.
q1: I'll be driving to Chichester Harbour on Friday with my partner and dog, then taking our dinghy out to our boat, Kite, which is moored in Itchenor Reach. We'll spend the day doing important repairs to the fuel system (a leak is causing the engine to stop unexpectedly and at dangerous times), cleaning the boat, lounging around in the sun and walking the dog in the evening, including dinner at the local pub. We'll then spend the night on the boat on her mooring and the next day, depending on the success of the fuel line fixing, we'll either go for a little sail around the harbour, or carry on with maintenance work. Saturday afternoon we will leave the boat in our dinghy, back to Itchenor and then drive home.
q2: I would give photos if I could! My boat is called Kite and is a Sparkman & Stephens 34 classic racing cruiser from 1970 (same vintage as me). We keep her on the A25 mooring, almost at the beginning of Itchenor Reach and opposite the entrance to the Bosham Channel. This is all part of Chichester Harbour. There are a lot of utterly beautiful keel boats here, like Swallows and Sunbeams and it's lovely to just sit on our boat and watch them glide by when they're out racing. They come so close to our boat we can virtually touch them! We spend a lot of time on our boat (and I Would like to spend more) and she requires quite a lot of maintenance, being an old boat (like me...). We are planning a cross-channel trip in August and have lots ot do to the boat before we set off for Brittany. Our dog is a half-staffy/half-husky rescue and she hates sailing, so we leave her with our dog walker when we sail for long trips. It looks like it's going to continue to be sunny this weekend so it's a perfect time to be on the boat.

signevent: Buying new fruit trees to plant in the garden.
q1: My partner and I will be going to a number of different nurseries to buy some bare rooted fruit trees.  We have decided to plant apricots, plums, cherries and apples.  We have plenty of land, so we won't be using dwarf varieties.  The plan is to have a fully functioning orchid within 10 years.  I have prepared sites by digging in manure, compost and specific fertilisers. We will need to get different varieties of each fruit, to ensure good pollination.
q2: I have decided on sweet cherries.  Sunburst and Merchant are my top choices.  For apricots I will get one for drying and one for fresh eating, perhaps Hunter and Blenheim.  For the plums, I cannot go past Coe's Golden Drop, and perhaps a President.  For manure, I have used a mixture of cow, sheep, chicken and horse.  My compost is home made, with kitchen scraps, muck from the chicken house and general garden trimmings.

signevent: Taking a brazilian jiu jitsu competition class
q1: This is a 90 minute, fast paced and intense grappling class, oriented towards preparing participants to compete in grappling tournaments. I have a big fight coming up in September so it’s important to me to put everything into these classes, to improve my endurance as well as technique. The class starts at 7:30pm on Friday.
q2: The class starts with light sparring, known as ‘flow rolling’, just to get warmed up. We then jump straight into a variety of positional sparring drills, usually utilising all the main jiu jitsu positions and switching between attack and defense. We have specific goals in mind during these drills, such as attaining a sweep or a submission. We often then do some fast paced judo drills, mix in some burpees, and end the class with full on sparring.

signevent: Going to my weekly yoga class on Wednesday evening from 6pm until 7pm
q1: My mum and I drive to the class at about 5:45pm, which is held in a local hotel by the harbour. We go downstairs into the yoga room, collect a mat and a blanket each, set this up and say hello to the other members of the group. Sometimes, my mum meets her friend at the class. The room is dark and lit by candles and fairy lights. Just after 6pm, the yoga teacher turns on some relaxing music and we begin to do some gentle poses. As the class progresses, we do some more challenging poses, such as the warrior and the tree. Towards the end of the class, the lights are dimmed further and we are told to lie down and relax for a while, trying to picture a sunset in our heads. We wrap the blankets around us at this stage as it can get cold really quickly once you start to relax. At the end of the class, we leave our mats where they were ready for the next class, thank the yoga teacher and drive home feeling really relaxed. We pay for the sessions in groups of 6 online.
q2: Each session costs £8. The yoga teacher's name is Becky. Around 6-8 people attend the class each week. My favourite yoga pose is the warrior.

signevent: I am going to be playing bass guitar in a concert that will be starting tonight and running through until Wednesday.
q1: It has been a long time coming, but I am very excited to be playing as part of a support act in a series of summer concerts which start today and run until next Wednesday.  Although we are not part of the main act (although I am sure that we will be one day!), it is a major achievement for my band (Automation) and I to have been asked to perform as a support act.  We will be the first band on stage and, although I am very, very nervous, I am also terribly excited to have the opportunity to play bass guitar, along with my band, in front of thousands of people.
q2: Music wasn't my first love until nearly 5 years ago, when I happened to come across a free course to begin to learn the guitar.  It was slow going to start with, but I kept at it, even through the blisters and the annoyance of trying and failing to get a riff correct again, and again...  After lots of lessons, and going through the grading process (I have now achieved Grade 8), I decided to look into joining a band.  The first one was a dismal failure for more reasons than I can recount.  The second time I hit the jackpot, and Automation has now become a serious component in my life, and happiness.  We started performing gigs together and have slowly built up a pretty amazing following.  We were thrilled to be asked to be the opening act for these concerts.  It's not 'the big time' yet, but it will be soon!

signevent: Flying a kite with my best friend, Betsy.

q2: When we were in Secondary School, we had to do a research report on Thomas "Kite" Kitero, who was a leading factor in the popularity of the kite when he made it the primary focus of his entertainment act.  Kitero's birthday was July 28, 1682. Betsy and I always felt that Kitero's  contribution to entertainment has widely gone unnoticed in the modern age, so we celebrate his birthday to do our part to keep the joy alive.

signevent: I will be cleaning my aquarium and re positioning corals inside of it.
q1: I start off by moving my pet fish into a temporary water bucket. Afterward, I turn off my water pump and pour the old water out of my aquarium. Then I use cleaning fluid and a towel to wipe my aquarium clean. Then I replace any corals that look old with new corals and throw away the old ones. After that I refill the aquarium with water and start my water pump again. Then I move my fish back into the aquarium.
q2: I have to be quick while cleaning the aquarium because I don't put a water pump i the bucket with my fishes while I am doing the change. That means the bucket is unsafe for them and I should remove them fast. Also the cleaning fluid I use for my aquarium is specifically designed for glass and fish bowl cleaning.

I would have at least 15 g of water made up to add. Then move the rock, siphon out some of the nasty water from moving the rock around and replace. signevent: Our first annual scarecrow festival.
q1: Whilst it may seem early in the year to hold such an event, we have taken months to prepare and organise this. We have liaised with the local Council and the community to hold an event which would create and bring more awareness to the south west and farming communities. We hope to encourage families and children of all ages to attend and learn more about local produce within our community and create a fun atmosphere whilst promoting more awareness and encouragement to purchase local organic produce.
q2: We have taken just over 11 months to approach local businesses and arrange for the event to be held at a local farm. We have invested time and money in promoting the event and have used social media, flyers etc in family friendly venues to encourage attendance. We also approached the Council with our idea and for assistance where possible from the outset. Whilst we have not had as many businesses participating to promote the main cause of the festival, we have approached other businesses/ people to possibly sell arts and crafts or children entertainers to assist and create the atmosphere we hope for.

signevent: Going to the Dr. to get my drains out
q1:
Next week, I plan on spending my leisure time FINALLY getting my drains out. They itch like crazy right now. I thought, going in, that they were just going to do my top surgery, bandage me up, and then I'd go in for a couple follow-up check-ups to make sure things were healing alright. But no, I should have known better. Of course with an incision big enough to remove my entire breast on either side, there's going to be some fluid build-up while it's healing. That said, it is definitely not a comfortable thing. 
Right now, I have clear tubing coming from either incision. The tubing leads to these pod-shaped 'bottles' that collect all of the gross fluids from my surgery recovery. I've been using a stretchy ace bandage around my midsection to tuck the drainage containers into so they don't interfere with things. But, despite my best efforts, they still manage to slip around and get loose or shift and dig into my rib-cage. 
Finally, FINALLY, I get to get these things taken out. No more stinging when the tubes get pulled on, no more itching bandaging, no more nausea-inducing emptying of who-knows-what down the sink at the end of every day. All I have to do is show up at the clinic, go back to the office, lay down on the bed, and get this final weight (literally and metaphorically) off/out of my chest.
q2:
While I have a different general physician for other unrelated issues, I spent a long time deciding on which surgeon to see for my mastectomy/top surgery. After a lot of research, I decided on Dr. Kimberly Vanderveen in Denver Colorado. I met with her multiple times before the procedure. During these meetings she explained to me exactly what she'd be doing while I was under the anesthesia. She made sure that I knew this would be an irreversible process, and that if I ever decided I wanted my breasts 'back', the only option would be implants. She also let me know that no surgery is perfect - there would be scarring afterwards that would probably never completely fade, and while she would do her best to make sure everything lined up correctly, mistakes happen. By the time I walked out of her office for the last time before going in to get the surgery done, I felt super comfortable with the whole thing. I've been waiting for this for YEARS now - I was so excited the night before my appointment that I barely slept. 
My appointment next week is on Wednesday at 11:00am at my clinic in town. I won't be seeing the same surgeon, obviously, but I've spoken to her on the phone. This is not the first time I've gone in to get my drains out - the first two times they sent me home saying that there was still too much fluid build-up under the skin for it to be safe to remove them. It's going to be so nice to have my freedom back again, even if there are still some bandages left over.

signevent: I'm going to be attending a junior athletics match with my children.
q1:
This weekend, I'll be attending a junior athletics match with my kids. My son has been practicing Taekwondo for a little over two years now, and has gotten quite competitive. This will be his first regional match, so I'm a little nervous about the size and scale of what we'll encounter, but from what I've seen at the local matches it should prove to be an interesting day. 

The matches tend to be broken out into different activities, which evaluate a number of skills. Kids are tested on basic skills (with activities like board breaking), "forms" (which are choreographed sequences of attacks), and sparring. At the local match, a winner was picked for each of these. I believe at the regional level, my son will be competing for an overall prize as well.

It may sound strange, but I find these matches are a great way to unwind. My daughter - my youngest child - seems to find the whole thing mesmerizing, so it's a nice way to spend time with her without chasing her, or having to worry about how charged the iPad is. My son really puts his all into these competitions and has a great attitude about it all. It's humbling for me, and really helps me unwind from all of the stress and turmoil of work.
q2: The match is scheduled for this Saturday at 8:00am, at the Thomasville Community Centre. It's being run under the banner of the World Taekwondo Federation. I'm planning to drop off the dog with my brother in law on the way to the event - it's currently summer and if we leave him in the backyard, he'll bark and drive the neighbors mad.
